meanings.definition: The quality or state of being tar-like.
meanings.sent1: The road's tarrinesses made it difficult to walk smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The tarrinesses of the substance made it perfect for waterproofing.
meanings.sent3: The tarrinesses of the spilled tar caused quite a mess in the garage.
meanings.sent4: The tarrinesses of the situation stuck to him like a shadow.
meanings.sent5: The tarrinesses of the asphalt under the scorching sun created a gooey mess.

meanings.definition: The act or process of applying tar.
meanings.sent1: The tarrinesses of the road were a result of recent maintenance work.
meanings.sent2: His job involved the tarrinesses of sealing cracks in the pavement.
meanings.sent3: The tarrinesses of the roofing project left him covered in black goo.
meanings.sent4: The tarrinesses of the painter's brush strokes transformed the fence.
meanings.sent5: The tarrinesses of the driveway repair required careful handling of hot tar.

meanings.definition: A feeling of stickiness or heaviness.
meanings.sent1: The tarrinesses of the humid air made breathing uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't shake off the tarrinesses of the syrup on her fingers.
meanings.sent3: The tarrinesses of the situation weighed on his mind like a heavy burden.
meanings.sent4: The tarrinesses of the glue made it challenging to separate the papers.
meanings.sent5: The tarrinesses of the mud on his shoes slowed down his pace.
